means: 不礼貌的，失礼的，粗鲁的

sentence.Network_en: I was impolite and I do beg your pardon.
It is impolite to ask too many questions.
sentence.Network_cn: 提出过多的问题是不礼貌的。

sentence.Network_en: Don't stare at me— it's impolite!
sentence.Network_cn: 别盯着我看——这是不礼貌的！

PerfectNetExp.abs: 高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... spirit n 烈酒（常用复数）；精神；情绪 impolite adj 无礼的；粗鲁的 wing n 翅膀；机翼.
英文前缀 - 豆丁网 ... impossible（ 不可能的）， impolite（ 不礼貌的）， impudence（ 厚颜无耻） 4．.
高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... spirit n 烈酒（常用复数）；精神；情绪 impolite adj 无礼的；粗鲁的 wing n 翅膀；机翼.
星火网络“一点通”单词记忆法 - 外语角 - 时空网 ... impossible 不可能 impolite 不礼貌 immature 不成熟的.

list.abs: impolite是什么意思|impolite的中文意思... ... (for) 考虑到; be impolite ： 没规矩 IMPOLITE ENCOUNTERS ： 非常套用语.
Hurt by their impolite words , he flared up ., 由于他们那些不礼貌的话伤害了他 , 他突然发火了.
speaking with your mouth full is very impolite ., 嘴里塞满食物时讲话是很不礼貌的.
She ordered that impolite fellow out ., 她责令那个无礼的家伙出去.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the sense 'unpolished'): from Latin impolitus, from in- 'not' + politus (see polite)

entry.tran: 不礼貌的;无礼的;粗鲁的
entry.def: If you say that someone is impolite, you mean that they are rather rude and do not have good manners.

example.ex: It is impolite to ask too many questions.
example.tran: 提出过多的问题是不礼貌的。

example.ex: It would be most ungracious and impolite to refuse a simple invitation to supper with him.
example.tran: 连与他共进晚餐这样的简单邀请都拒绝会显得非常失礼,没有教养。

auth_sentence.content: This has become a very impolite society toward women.
auth_sentence.res_content: This has become a very impolite society toward women.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This has become a very impolite society toward women.

auth_sentence.content: She imagined that I used certain impolite words...to cause a sensation.
auth_sentence.res_content: She imagined that I used certain impolite words...to cause a sensation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She imagined that I used certain impolite words...to cause a sensation.

auth_sentence.content: Celia felt it would be impolite to ask how old he was.
auth_sentence.res_content: Celia felt it would be impolite to ask how old he was.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Celia felt it would be impolite to ask how old he was.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"向内,成为,进入,使……"; 2. 表示"不,无,非"

stems_affixes.word_buile: im向内,成为,进入,使……+passion激情+ed……的→adj.慷慨激昂的
im向内,成为,进入,使……+plic重叠+it→进入重叠→不直说→储蓄的
im不,无,非+moral道德的→adj.不道德的
im不,无,非+partial有偏见的→adj.公平的
im不,无,非+pecc斑点+able……的→无斑点的
im不,无,非+possible可能的→adj.不可能的
im向内,成为,进入,使……+migrate移居→入住
im向内,成为,进入,使……+pel推→推进,驱动
im向内,成为,进入,使……+peril危险→v.使处于危险中
im向内,成为,进入,使……+person人+ate表动词→进入别人→扮演别人
im向内,成为,进入,使……+prison监狱→v.监禁
im向内,成为,进入,使……+pulse跳动→内在推动→冲动

means.word_mean: 不礼貌的;失礼的;粗鲁的

sentences.en: She ordered that impolite fellow out.
sentences.cn: 她责令那个无礼的家伙出去。

sentences.en: He wasn’t just impolite—he was downright rude.
sentences.cn: 他不仅仅是不礼貌，而是无礼透顶。

sentences.en: His impolite words angered his teacher.
sentences.cn: 他出言不逊,激怒了他的老师。

sentences.en: It is impolite to get a word in.
sentences.cn: 别人谈话时插嘴是不礼貌的。

sentences.en: It isn’t easy to put up with people who are impolite.
sentences.cn: 没有礼貌的人是令人难以容忍的。

sentences.en: It’s impolite to make a tardy appearance.
